docs.snippet: NEW HAVEN, Conn., April 17-- Professor Frederick Bliss Luquiens, chairman of the Department of Spanish and Italian at Yale University and an authority on SpanishAmerican literature, died at his home here today after a short illness, at the age of 64....
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW HAVEN, Conn., April 17-- Professor Frederick Bliss Luquiens, chairman of the Department of Spanish and Italian at Yale University and an authority on SpanishAmerican literature, died at his home here today after a short illness, at the age of 64. Death was due to a coronary thrombosis.

headline.main: PROF. F.B. LUQUIENS OF YALE DIES AT 64; Street Professor of Modern Languages Taught at the University 43 Years FATHER HELD SAME POST Authority on Spanish-American Literature Was Captain in Intelligence Unit in War

docs.snippet: MUSIC directed by Arturo Toscanini is not to be lost  to the North American radio audience while the maestro is touring South America this Summer.

docs.snippet: Members of The Associated Press moved at their fortieth annual meeting here yesterday to broaden the organization's policy covering use of its news services for sponsored radio programs.

docs.snippet: The World's Fair turned the tables on itself yesterday. Up till now it has boasted of its efficient, almost machine-like organization and of ifs $155,000,000 worth of exhibits.
